text: the name Yakuza is derived from the
numbers eight nine and three a losing
hand in a Japanese card game they trace
their origins back to the 17th century
today they own most of their money
through gambling prostitution and
extortion while many of their activities
are criminal the organization's
themselves are not they even have
offices registered members and business
cards the Japanese police say there are
around 60,000 members in the country
they're often heavily tattooed and some
are even missing fingers punishment for
stepping out of line the biggest Yakuza
group is the Yamaguchi Gumi from Kobe
with around 23,000 members they're led
by scheana boots Casas he spent 13 years
in prison for killing a rival with a
samurai sword in the 1970s
